intro: Clidemia rubra var. cordifolia, commonly known as red-veined velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are typically reddish or purplish on the underside, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Clidemia rubra var. cordifolia is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture.
